page.title: 01Local History Life-style
page.content: The earliest available documents show {Consett}under the name{'Corkshed'}or {Conshead.}By the time of Henry VIII the name{'Conside'}(Latin) or {Consett}(English) was in use.{Consett was also called{'Berry Edge',}a reference to it's position on the edge of Lanchester Common. The area named{'Delves Lane' derives from German refugees who mined ironstone in pits called{'delf' or {'delve'}holes. {Consett}does not appear in the original Domesday Book but is mentioned in the Bolden of 1183. There is little in the way of Historical monuments in the area but one important landmark of the age of steam is the{Gill Viaduct}built in 1858 to enable a rail to cross adeep ravine.The Bridge 700ft. long, 175ft. high is notorious as a suicide spot.
